mesa 0.2.1
  • Reference

    This function takes a qseaSet and plots a PCA

    plotQseaPCA.Rd

    This function takes a qseaSet and plots a PCA

    plotQseaPCA(
  qseaSet,
  signatureGR = NULL,
  plotComponents = c(1, 2),
  plotColour = "type",
  plotShape = "experiment",
  batchVariable = NULL,
  showNames = FALSE,
  normMethod = "beta",
  minRowSum = 20,
  minEnrichment = 3,
  topVar = NULL,
  plotTitle = "",
  returnDataOnly = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    qseaSet

    The qseaSet object.

    signatureGR

    A GRanges (or data frame coercible to one) with a subset of windows to calculate the PCA on.

    plotComponents

    Which of the PCA components to plot default c(1,2)

    plotColour

    Column of the sampleTable to use to set the colour of the points

    plotShape

    Column of the sampleTable to use to set the shape of the points

    batchVariable

    A variable to use for batch correction using limma. Can be overaggressive and remove all variation. Be careful with this!

    showNames

    Whether to show the names of the points

    normMethod

    Normalisation method to use, nrpm or beta.

    minRowSum

    A minimum number of reads to be included in the PCA

    minEnrichment

    Minimal number of expected reads for a fully methylated window (for transformation to absolute methylation level)

    topVar

    Take only the n most variable windows in the PCA. If NULL, all valid windows.

    plotTitle

    Title for the plot

    returnDataOnly

    Return just the data frame behind the PCA

    Value

    A plot of the PCA

    Contents

    Developed by Simon Pearce, Steven Hill.
